body_html:
Okay. I will look forward it if there's a point I can contribute.
By the way, is it somewhat "uncommon" to use tensordot function?
I was a user of "reshape (or transpose) - matmul - reshape (or transpose)" approach previously, and am finding methods for doing this boring series of operations.
I think einsum function is an attractive alternative, indeed more powerful alternative. A single question that makes me hesitate to move to einsum is: is there no performance issue?

body:
Okay. I will look forward it if there's a point I can contribute.
By the way, is it somewhat "uncommon" to use `tensordot` function?
I was a user of "reshape (or transpose) - matmul - reshape (or transpose)" approach previously, and am finding methods for doing this boring series of operations.
I think `einsum` function is an attractive alternative, indeed more powerful alternative. A single question that makes me hesitate to move to `einsum` is: is there no performance issue?
